result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas E Boschert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 7 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas E Boschert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas E Boschert in court with attorney Frank J. Parise.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
Plea - Ct.1 - G.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - DRI.   15CM855 - DRI.
$200+cc+DNA, 60 dtp, ftp 7 days RCJ for contempt.

Defendant Thomas E Boschert in court with attorney Frank J. Parise.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft has picked up new misd. charges.
Deft is going to be entering into treatment.
State will not be asking to modify bond in this case at this time.
BTC: Bond will remain as set at this time.
Bail/bond hearing on April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas E Boschert in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is not in compliance with ZCI.
State has extended an offer.
State is requesting a 30 day adjournment.
If deft tests dirty, the State is going to issue BJ charges.
BTC: Atty rights given, Deft must go to ZCI after court today, adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $800.00 SIGNATURE BOND***    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Thomas E Boschert in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas E Boschert not in court.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
Initial appearance on January 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
